children.subject: I don't think you would be in trouble, as far as I know, there is no rule saying "students MUST declare in the semester they finish or take the prerequisites"

history.content: You're not in trouble! If we have all three of your grades for declaration now, then we will look at them with the other applications and declare you, assuming you have the 3.3 average. Those decisions will come in another few weeks, since some of the important grades still haven't come in, and then we need to do all of the processing for declarations plus all of you who are graduating (we do many of those by hand too).

So I took my last prerequisite for an incomplete last fall and didn’t submit a declaration application, as I figured it wouldn’t be able to be processed. I just finished it this semester and am planning on submitting the application now. Is that alright? Or will I be in trouble because I technically took it Fall 2020 and didn’t submit an application then?
history.subject: Incomplete & Declaration
